sources.title: "The Hazards of Helen" (1916) starring Helen Gibson
sources.description: This gem is presented by Silent Hall of Fame.   Please visit https://silent-hall-of-fame.org/   to support our non-profit mission and the legacy of silent movie stars by making a tax deductible contribution.   FEEL FREE TO FOLLOW US ON TWITTER @SilentFilmGems   We have included this film in our program to illustrate the work and contributions of our star Helen Gibson. This is possibly a short excerpt from an unknown episode of an action serial by the name of "The Hazards of Helen" starring Helen Gibson.  As with all other episodes, this one was likely directed by J.P. McGowan from a story by Edward T. Matlack.  A total of 119 weekly one reel films were produced by Kalem, showing just how popular this serial was in 1914-1917.  The first 48 films starred Helen Holmes, the remaining 71 starred Helen Gibson.  They both played heroines that were independent and adventurous, resolving dangerous situations with quick thinking.  Their acting was very physical and they performed their often very dangerous stunts.  It is believed to be the longest film series in the silent era and one of the longest ever.  Very few of the films survive, and we are happy to  be able to show this rarity to our esteemed viewers. sources.title: 1916 The Hazards Of Helen The Open Track
sources.description: Helen works at a train depot, gets involved with a federal investigation of counterfeiters. Another action packed adventure for our heroine, Helen Cast Helen Gibson ... Helen Robyn Adair ... 1st Detective  Clarence Burton ... 2nd Detective  Franklin Hall ... 1st Counterfeiter  George Robinson ... 2nd Counterfeiter  Glen Gano ... 3rd Counterfeiter  Directed by J. Gunnis Davis Written by Edward T. Matlack Produced by James Davis Details Country USA Release Date: January 22, 1916 Production Co: Kalem Company

metadata.Plot: Helen, informed of the danger which menaces an excursion train because another engine on the same track is running wild, mounts a motorcycle and speeds down the track to warn the passengers of their imminent peril.
metadata.Director: J. Gunnis Davis, J.P. McGowan, Robert G. Vignola
metadata.Writer: Frank Howard Clark, John Russell Corvell, Scott Darling
metadata.Actors: Helen Holmes, Helen Gibson, J.P. McGowan
